history.text: I just watched Bruce Almighty.
Awesome, did you like it?
Yeah, I thought it was really funny.  Jim Carrey was great.
I haven't seen it yet. I do like Jim Carrey though.
He was really good.  Morgan Freeman was in it too.  He played God.
I think Morgan Freeman is a great actor. Who else is in it?
Jennifer Aniston plays Grace, Jim's wife.
Great cast so far. Is it family friendly?
Definitely.  It's a comedy with some slapstick and would be enjoyable for families.
Are there some adult joke? Do you think it's appropriate for a child under 13?
I'm down for a good comedy but would like to watch with my daughter.
I think a child under 13 would enjoy it.

There are some good scenes like when he loses the promotion to his rival Evan.  Your daughter would like that scene.
\
Thanks for giving me the heads up.
It's hard to find good movies to watch with kids :-)
The rating on rotten tomatoes aren't that great, but I think they aren't giving it enough credit.  It was very funny.
I don't like rotten tomatoes that's a place for people with no taste, lol.
What did you take away from the movie? any moral?
I love a movie with a good moral
Yeah, it had a good message.  Bruce becomes God and has to answer everyone's prayers, and he finds it is overwhelming to him.  He decides to say Yes to every one.
It is an interesting way of explaining why you can't always have a prayer answered.
Wow, that's a good moral especially nowadays.
It doesn't sound overtly religious and sounds like a fun movie. Doesn't sound offensive either!

Definitely.  It also shows how having infinite power does not answer all your questions.  Bruce disappoints his girlfriend by only thinking about himself and taking her to dinner about his promotion when she thought it was about a proposal
Ouch, awkward.
I'm going to assume he comes to his senses as she gives him another change? I like a happy ever after movie too :-)
He prays to God to give Grace a man she deserves and she winds up back with Bruce.
He also tones down his need for being the best at work, and accepts a more humble position.
Thanks for the info. I like when they can take a character and turn them around in the end.
Yeah, he definitely did and learned a lot.
The movie ends with a homeless man holding a philosophical sign.
It was a deep movie for a comedy.
yeah it is deep! nice ending
Thank you for giving me more info :-)

uid1response.feedback: It sounds like a good family movie.
